meanings.meaning: 1. stuffing; packing づめ when a suffixどの電車も通勤者でぎゅうぎゅう詰めだった。The trains were jammed with commuters.
2. end (esp. the foot of a bridge)
3. lowest-ranking guest at tea ceremony
4. tea master
5. endgame (esp. in shogi or used figuratively) 最後の詰めを怠ったばかりに、画竜点睛を欠くはめになってしまったね。You kept putting off working on the fine details on this project so it ended up lacking the finishing touches.
6. sweet eel sauce Abbreviation
7. middle-aged woman Archaic
8. appointment to a particular workplace
9. using as the sole ground of judgement (judgment)
10. continuing; keep doing for period of time after the -masu stem of a verb我々はしゃべりづめで夜半まで起きていた。We sat up half the night just talking.
詰め 【づめ】、詰 【つめ】、詰 【づめ】

sentences.translation: The trains were jammed with commuters.
You kept putting off working on the fine details on this project so it ended up lacking the finishing touches.
We sat up half the night just talking.

meanings.meaning: 1. dull; uninteresting; boring; tedious Usually written using kana aloneあの新しい映画は、つまらんかった。That new movie was a bummer.
2. insignificant; unimportant; trifling; trivial; worthless Usually written using kana aloneあの男はよくつまらぬことで誰にでも因縁をつける。He often uses the slightest thing as a pretext for a fight with anybody.
3. absurd; foolish; silly; stupid Usually written using kana alone
4. useless; pointless; disappointing Usually written using kana alone
詰まらない 【つまらない】
1. dull; uninteresting; boring; tedious Usually written using kana aloneあの新しい映画は、つまらんかった。That new movie was a bummer.
2. insignificant; unimportant; trifling; trivial; worthless Usually written using kana aloneあの男はよくつまらぬことで誰にでも因縁をつける。He often uses the slightest thing as a pretext for a fight with anybody.
3. absurd; foolish; silly; stupid Usually written using kana alone
4. useless; pointless; disappointing Usually written using kana alone
詰まらない 【つまらない】

sentences.translation: That new movie was a bummer.
He often uses the slightest thing as a pretext for a fight with anybody.

meanings.meaning: 1. that is to say; that is; in other words; I mean; that (this, it) means Usually written using kana alone

2. in short; in brief; to sum up; ultimately; in the end; in the long run; when all is said and done; what it all comes down to; when you get right down to it; basically Usually written using kana alone
3. clogging; obstruction; stuffing; (degree of) blockage Usually written using kana alone
4. shrinkage Usually written using kana alone
5. end; conclusion Usually written using kana alone, See also とどのつまり
6. dead end; corner Usually written using kana alone, Archaic
7. distress; being at the end of one's rope Usually written using kana alone, Archaic
詰り 【つまり】
1. that is to say; that is; in other words; I mean; that (this, it) means Usually written using kana alone

2. in short; in brief; to sum up; ultimately; in the end; in the long run; when all is said and done; what it all comes down to; when you get right down to it; basically Usually written using kana alone
3. clogging; obstruction; stuffing; (degree of) blockage Usually written using kana alone
4. shrinkage Usually written using kana alone
5. end; conclusion Usually written using kana alone, See also とどのつまり
6. dead end; corner Usually written using kana alone, Archaic
7. distress; being at the end of one's rope Usually written using kana alone, Archaic
詰り 【つまり】
1. to stuff into; to jam; to cram; to pack; to fill; to plug; to stop up この穴を何かで詰めなくては。We've got to fill this hole with something.

meanings.type: Ichidan verb, Transitive verb, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to shorten; to move closer together このブラウスをつめていただけますか。Could I have this blouse taken in, please?
3. to reduce (spending); to conserve

meanings.type: Ichidan verb, Transitive verb, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to focus intently on; to strain oneself to do See also 根を詰める, usu. as 根を詰める
5. to go through thoroughly; to work out (details); to bring to a conclusion; to wind up
6. to be on duty; to be stationed
7. to corner (esp. an opponent's king in shogi); to trap; to checkmate
8. to cut off (one's finger as an act of apology); to catch (one's finger in a door, etc.) See also 指を詰める, the meaning "to catch one's finger" is predominantly used in Kansai
9. to do non-stop; to do continuously; to keep doing (without a break)
10. to do completely; to do thoroughly
11. to force someone into a difficult situation by ...

Could I have this blouse taken in, please?

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to be at a loss; to be hard pressed See also 言葉に詰まる, See also 気の詰まる きのつまる, often in the form …につまる

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to end up; to be settled See also 詰まる所 つまるところ

meanings.meaning: 6. to become a geminate consonant See also 促音 そくおん

大詰 【おおづめ】

切りつめる 【きりつめる】、切詰める 【きりつめる】

追いつめる 【おいつめる】

行き詰まる 【ゆきづまる】、行き詰る 【いきづまる】、行き詰る 【ゆきづまる】、行きづまる 【いきづまる】、行きづまる 【ゆきづまる】、行詰まる 【いきづまる】、行詰まる 【ゆきづまる】、行詰る 【いきづまる】、行詰る 【ゆきづまる】

登り詰める 【のぼりつめる】、昇り詰める 【のぼりつめる】

敷きつめる 【しきつめる】、敷詰める 【しきつめる】
